title: Get Started
text: plotr package includes several theme functions quickly style ggplot2 visualizations:

title: Get Started
text: theme_text() provides consistent text styling Helvetica font appropriate sizing:
code: ggplot(mtcars, aes(wt, mpg)) +   geom_point() +   theme_text() +   labs(title = "theme_text() Example")

title: Get Started
text: theme_border() provides clean theme borders:
code: ggplot(mtcars, aes(wt, mpg)) +   geom_point() +   theme_border() +   theme_text() +   labs(title = "theme_border() Example")

title: Get Started
text: theme_line() provides minimal theme axis lines instead full borders:
code: ggplot(mtcars, aes(wt, mpg)) +   geom_point() +   theme_line() +   theme_text() +   labs(title = "theme_line() Example")

title: Get Started
text: themes include: theme_noaxisticks(): Theme without axis ticks theme_gridlines(): Lighter gridlines styling facet_aes(): Enhanced facet_wrap aesthetics umap_aes(): Special aesthetics dimension reduction plots

title: Get Started
text: plotr package provides access various color palettes:

title: Get Started

code: display_palettes()

title: Get Started
text: can use get_palette() function retrieve colors palette:  get_palette() function also works viridis RColorBrewer palettes:
code: # Get colors from a package palette kelly_colors <- get_palette(pal_kelly_20, n = 5) print(kelly_colors) #> [1] "#f3c300" "#875692" "#f38400" "#a1caf1" "#be0032"  # Use with ggplot ggplot(mtcars, aes(wt, mpg, color = factor(cyl))) +   geom_point(size = 3) +   scale_color_manual(values = kelly_colors) +   theme_line() +   theme_text() +   labs(title = "Kelly Colors Palette Example") # Using viridis ggplot(mtcars, aes(wt, mpg, color = factor(cyl))) +   geom_point(size = 3) +   scale_color_manual(values = get_palette("viridis", n = 3)) +   theme_line() +   theme_text() +   labs(title = "Viridis Palette Example") # Using RColorBrewer ggplot(mtcars, aes(wt, mpg, color = factor(cyl))) +   geom_point(size = 3) +   scale_color_manual(values = get_palette("Blues", n = 3)) +   theme_line() +   theme_text() +   labs(title = "Blues Palette Example")

title: Get Started
text: plot_percent() function creates percentage/frequency bar plots:
code: # Convert variables to factors first mtcars$cyl <- as.factor(mtcars$cyl) mtcars$am <- as.factor(mtcars$am)  # Basic percentage plot plot_percent(mtcars, group.by = "am", variable = "cyl")

title: Get Started
text: function many customization options:
code: # With custom colors plot_percent(   mtcars,    group.by = "am",    variable = "cyl",   cols = get_palette("viridis", n = 3),   bar.width = 0.7,   bar.color = "black",   y.label = "Percentage" )

title: Get Started
text: can also create faceted plots:
code: # Convert vs to factor mtcars$vs <- as.factor(mtcars$vs)  # Faceted plot plot_percent(   mtcars,    group.by = "am",    variable = "cyl",   facet.by = "vs",   cols = get_palette(pal_kelly_20, n = 3) )

title: Get Started
text: can change orientation horizontal:
code: plot_percent(   mtcars,    group.by = "am",    variable = "cyl",   orientation = "horizontal",   theme = "border",   cols = get_palette(pal_zissou_5, n = 3),   x.label = "Transmission Type" )

title: Get Started
text: dimension reduction plots, can use umap_aes() function:
code: # Create sample UMAP data set.seed(123) umap_data <- data.frame(   UMAP1 = rnorm(100),   UMAP2 = rnorm(100),   cluster = sample(LETTERS[1:5], 100, replace = TRUE) )  # Plot with umap_aes ggplot(umap_data, aes(UMAP1, UMAP2, color = cluster)) +   geom_point(size = 3) +   theme_text() +   scale_color_manual(values = get_palette(pal_brewerplus_41, n = 5)) +   labs(title = "UMAP Example") +   umap_aes()

code: if (!require("devtools", quietly = TRUE))     install.packages("devtools") remotes::install_github("hungms/plotr")

title: Plot Themes for R
text: plotr depends following packages: * ggplot2 - creating graphics * dplyr - data manipulation plot_percent() * magrittr - pipe operator (%>%) used data processing * stringr - string operations get_palette() * Supporting packages: cowplot, viridis, ggrepel, patchwork, wesanderson, RColorBrewer
code: # Install required packages from CRAN install.packages(c("ggplot2", "dplyr", "magrittr", "stringr", "cowplot", "viridis", "ggrepel", "patchwork", "wesanderson", "RColorBrewer"))

title: Plot Themes for R
text: plotr offers multiple theme options suit different visualization needs, providing enhanced aesthetics compared default ggplot2 themes: Compare theme_bw() (default ggplot2), theme_border() theme_line() (plotr): Compare themes applied bar charts:

title: Plot Themes for R
code: library(plotr) library(ggplot2)  # Simple scatter plot with plotr theme ggplot(mtcars, aes(x = wt, y = mpg, color = factor(cyl))) +   geom_point(size = 3) +   theme_line() +    theme_text() +   scale_color_manual(values = c("#f3c300", "#875692", "#f38400")) +   labs(title = "Car Weight vs MPG by Cylinders",         color = "Cylinders")

title: Plot Themes for R
code: # Convert categorical variables to factors mtcars$cyl <- as.factor(mtcars$cyl) mtcars$am <- as.factor(mtcars$am)  # Create a proportion plot ggplot(mtcars, aes(x = am, fill = cyl)) +   geom_bar(position = "fill", width = 0.85, color = "white") +   scale_y_continuous(labels = scales::percent) +   scale_fill_viridis_d() +   theme_line() +   theme_text() +   labs(x = "Transmission (0 = Automatic, 1 = Manual)",        y = "Proportion",        fill = "Cylinders") +   ggtitle("Cylinders by Transmission Type")

title: Create percentage bar plots — plot_percent
text: Generate bar plots showing percentages frequencies across groups. function calculates percentages within groups creates stacked bar plot.

title: Create percentage bar plots — plot_percent
code: plot_percent(   df,   group.by,   variable,   facet.by = NULL,   cols = NULL,   legend.ncol = 1,   position = "stack",   bar.width = 0.85,   bar.color = "white",   orientation = "vertical",   y.label = "Frequency (%)",   x.label = "",   theme = "line" )

title: Create percentage bar plots — plot_percent
text: df Dataframe containing data plot. group.Column name group data (x-axis). variable Column name variable show different colors (fill). facet.Optional column name facet plot . Default NULL. cols Optional vector colors fill. Default NULL (uses default ggplot colors). legend.ncol Number columns legend. Default 1. position Position adjustment bars. Options "stack" (default) "fill". bar.width Width bars. Default 0.85. bar.color Color bar borders. Default "white". orientation Plot orientation. Options "vertical" (default) "horizontal". y.label Label y-axis. Default "Frequency (%)". x.label Label x-axis. Default "" (empty). theme Theme apply. Default "line". Options "line" "border".
